Authors:
Yin-Tse Huang, Miroslav Kolarik, Matthew T. Kasson, Jiri
Hulcr
Title:
Two new Geosmithia species in G. pallida species complex from
eastern USA
Keywords:
Geosmithia; subcortical beetles; symbiosis; phoretic
association; North America
Abstract:
Species of Geosmithia are cosmopolitan, albeit
understudied, fungi associated with phloem-feeding bark beetles on
various perennial woody hosts. Surveys conducted in eastern USA revealed
several Geosmithia isolates from subcortical beetle species had not been
characterized previously. Geosmithia isolates recovered from several
assayed bark beetles exhibited brownish-colored colonies, a
characteristic feature of species in G. pallida species complex (GPSC).
Molecular studies based on multiple loci (ITS, TEF-1Î±, Tub2, and RPB2)
resolved their phylogenetic placement within the GPSC. Two new
Geosmithia species, G. brunnea and G. proliferans, were here described
with morphological illustrations and molecular phylogeny presented.
